The announcement arrived only minutes before the search giant's first earnings call of 2011-- and boy oh boy, the executive shakeup had nothing to do with earnings. We've had a very strong quarter, said Eric Schmidt , referencing the company's revenues of$ 8.44 billion, up 26% year-over-year. Eric Schmidt has been CEO for nearly a decade. Sunday. Media reports during Egypt's political unrest had quoted Zahi Hawass as saying that looters damaged two mummies, but in a BBC interview on Sunday he said that this was not the case. They were not mummies, there were two skulls taken outside from the CT scan machine. Everything will go back to normal at Cairo Museum today, said Zahi Hawass , head of Egypt's antiquities authority since 2002. He was made a cabinet minister last week. at the search giant. No longer will Eric Schmidt sit in the CEO position-he has decided to step into the role of Executive Chairman, while Page slides in as CEO. The other Google cofounder, Sergey Brin , will devote his energy to strategic projects, in particular working on new products. Google made the announcement as part of its quarterly earnings report for the fourth fiscal quarter of 2010. ''. As Google's new chief executive, Page will lead product development and technology strategy, along with all day-to-day operations of the firm. Sergey Brin , who co-founded Google with Page, will devote his time and energy to strategic projects, in particular working on new products . His title will remain co-founder. In a blog post, Eric Schmidt said that he had been working with Page and Sergey Brin on ways to simplify Google's management structure and quicken decision making.

Colin Powell thinks that America`` isn't quite post-racial'' at this time.`` These problems still exist in post-racial America.'' However, he suggested that Henry Louis Gates should not have argued with the policeman arresting him. You don't argue with a police officer, he says.
